summary: The Advocates for Families Act of 2025 amends the Social Security Act to require states to facilitate access to family advocates for parents, foster parents, and legal guardians involved in child welfare cases. States must allow representation by family advocates, establish standards for their conduct, inform parents of their right to representation, and report to the Secretary of Health and Human Services on the impact of this right. The Secretary is required to submit biennial reports to Congress on the implementation of these provisions.
